name: sugar refinery construction | sugar refinery | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4476/documentation

Sugar refinery with a production capacity of 200 kt sugar per year (production period of 100-180 days/year, depending on the feedstock). Life time is taken as 50 years. Equivalent feed capacities vary from 1’300 kt/yr for sugar beets to 1’650 kt/yr for sugarcane.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

This process includes land use and occupation, buildings and facilities of a typical sugar refinery in the global context. Energy use for construction and related emissions and/or waste effluents are not included.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/429:Construction of other civil engineering projects/4290:Construction of other civil engineering projects
tags: Sector: Infrastructure & Machinery; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Global context. Applicable to any sugar refinery in the world.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Technology is of a standard sugar refinery, including washing of the feedstock, juice extraction, purification and crystallisation. Juice extraction is performed by diffusion.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data was adapted from the ethanol fermentation plant dataset.
